alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 04 at 4:30AM PDT until November 04 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: .A period of heavy rainfall is expected late Friday evening through Saturday afternoon across the Smith River Complex burn scar. Embedded showers will yield convectively enhanced rainfall rates and an increased threat of debris flows. The highest threat will be Saturday morning. Another front will bring the potential for additional flooding Sunday night and Monday. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE SMITH RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Smith River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Del Norte Interior. * WHEN...From 10 AM PDT this morning through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Smith River Complex burn scar Heavy rainfall rates may cause flash flooding due to debris flows. Residents near the Smith River Complex burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Falling rocks could make driving conditions hazardous on highway 199. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
